Article Title: Shehbaz Sharif backs Bangladesh stance: ‚ÄòWon‚Äôt play India‚Äô; Suryakumar Yadav says, ‚ÄòOur flight to Colombo is booked‚Äô
Article Text:
Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif, and India captain Suryakumar Yadav.

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

T20 World Cup | 'Our flight is booked and we are going' - Suryakumar Yadav on Pakistan's boycott

The impasse over the India-Pakistan T20 WC match showed no signs of being resolved, after Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif weighed in on the issue, calling their boycott of the February 15 match against India in Colombo an ‚Äúappropriate decision‚Äù. It was a ‚Äúconsidered stance‚Äù to support Bangladesh, he said.‚ÄúWe have taken a very clear stand on the T20 World Cup that we won‚Äôt play the match against India because there should be no politics on the sports field. We have taken a very considered stance, and we should completely stand by Bangladesh, and I think this is a very appropriate decision. We are with Bangladesh,‚Äù the PM said.Meanwhile, Bangladesh Youth and Sports Advisor Asif Nazrul acknowledged Sharif‚Äôs decision. ‚ÄúThank you, Pakistan,‚Äù Nazrul wrote in a social media post.As the start of this contentious World Cup nears, speaking at a pre-tournament captain‚Äôs press conferences from two different locations ‚Äì Mumbai‚Äôs BCCI headquarters and from Colombo ‚Äî both teams‚Äô captains broke their silence on the issue.‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt refused to play against Pakistan. They have refused. The mindset is pretty clear. We have not said no, it has come from them,‚Äù India skipper Suryakumar Yadav said.‚ÄúThe ICC has given a fixture, BCCI and the (Indian) govt has decided with the ICC on playing at a neutral venue. Our flight is booked for Colombo and we are going,‚Äù he added.Salman Ali Agha, his Pakistani opposite number, said, ‚ÄúThe India game is not in our control. It‚Äôs the govt‚Äôs and PCB‚Äôs decision and we respect that. Whatever they are going to say, we will do that.‚Äù‚ÄúIf we have to play them again in the semifinal or final, we will have to go back to them (govt) and act on their advice,‚Äù added the Pakistan skipper. The Indian captain acknowledged that the situation is ‚Äúnot easy‚Äù for those involved in the issue, including the ICC.‚ÄúI feel it is not an easy job. It is not my call. I am sure they (the ICC) might be working out something as well but it has come from the other govt or the nation, how can they (the ICC) help as well? Their (Pakistan‚Äôs) decision is not in my control. I wish I could take their decisions, but then it is their call,‚Äù said Suryakumar.‚ÄúWe have been told that we have to play a game in Colombo on Feb 15th. We played them three times in the Asia Cup, we played some good cricket. We won (all the matches) and we were very happy. Similarly, if we get an opportunity in Colombo, we will definitely play,‚Äù he added.Earlier, Inter national Cricket Council (ICC) had expressed serious concerns over the Pakistan govt‚Äôs decision.‚ÄúThis position of selective participation is difficult to reconcile with the fundamental premise of a global sporting event where all qualified teams are expected to compete on equal terms per the event schedule,‚Äù it had said. ‚ÄúThis decision is not in the interest of the global game or the welfare of fans worldwide.‚Äù
Article Summary: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif calls their boycott of the February 15 match against India in Colombo an ‚Äúappropriate decision‚Äô India captain Suryakumar Yadav: ‚ÄúThe ICC has given a fixture, BCCI and the (Indian) govt has decided with the ICC on playing at a neutral venue‚Äù

Article Title: Sabarimala gold theft case: ED summons Unnikrishnan Potti for detailed interrogation
Article Text:
Unnikrishnan Potty, the prime accused in the Sabarimala gold theft case, being brought to the Crime Branch office, in Thiruvananthapuram on Friday. (ANI)

Jayaram Records Statement Over Sabarimala Gold Plates; Devotional Role Clarified by Authorities

NEW DELHI: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday summoned Unnikrishnan Potti, the key accused in the Sabrimala gold-theft case, a day after he, along with three other acuused were granted statutory bail by a Special Investigation Team.Potti is accused of misappropriating gold from the Dwarapalaka idols, the sanctum sanctorum, pillars, and door frames of the Sabarimala temple. He was arrested in November last year and remained in judicial custody for over three months.Former TDB administrative officer S Sreekumar and former TDB administrative officer, Murari Babu were also question by ED earlier.Potti worked as a ‚Äòparikarmi' (assistant) to the keezhsanthi (assistant to chief priest) of Sabarimala from 2004 to 2008.In 2014, he came under the scanner of the devaswom vigilance as some dealings done at Sannidhanam without coupons came under suspicion. Though he was asked to leave Sannidhanam, he returned in a couple of years.The bail on Thursday came as the Crime Branch failed to submit the final report within the prescribed time.In its order, the court observed that the right to default bail under Section 167(2) was absolute and could not be denied based on the gravity of the offence.
Article Summary: Unnikrishnan Potti is accused of misappropriating gold from the Dwarapalaka idols, the sanctum sanctorum, pillars, and door frames of the Sabarimala temple. He was arrested in November last year and remained in judicial custody for over three months. Potti worked as a ‚Äòparikarmi‚Äô (assistant) to the keezhsanthi (ass assistant to chief priest) of SabARimala from 2004 to 2008.

Article Title: Ghaziabad sisters‚Äô suicide: ‚ÄòDeath would be better than beatings,‚Äô daughters wrote in diary; father deep in debt, sold their phones
Article Text:

, nor were they homeschooled. They did not play with other society kids either ‚ÄòK-culture‚Äô seemed to have become their refuge; the sisters even called each other by names borrowed from TV shows and appeared to be living in a parallel world

Diary and note to father

Isolation and loneliness

Family tensions

Household under strain

Investigation ongoing





GHAZIABAD: Three sisters, aged 16, 14 and 12, were found dead in the early hours of Wednesday after falling from the ninth floor of their apartment building in Ghaziabad, near Delhi.The girls were discovered lying next to each other on the premises of Bharat City residential complex, directly below a bedroom window of their flat. Police say all three died on the spot.A resident of the complex, Arun Kumar, told local media he witnessed the incident at around 2am while standing on his balcony in another tower.Also read: Inside the troubled Ghaziabad home: 2 marriages, wives leaving, no schooling for kids, mounting debts and more He said the eldest girl was seated on the window ledge with her back facing the compound, while the two younger girls stood in front of her, holding her tightly.‚ÄúSuddenly, the girl on the window leaned back and fell. Within seconds, the other two jumped,‚Äù Kumar said. He added that he ran downstairs and repeatedly called for an ambulance, which arrived at around 3.15am.Police took the girls to hospital, where doctors declared them dead on arrival.1.45 am2.00 am3.15 amLater in the day‚ÄòDidn‚Äôt go to school, were lonely‚ÄôAccording to investigators, the three sisters were sleeping with their mother in one room of the flat, while their father, Chetan Kumar , slept in another room with their son.‚ÄúAt around 1.45am, the girls woke up on the pretext of getting water,‚Äù said Nimish Patil, Deputy Commissioner of Police (Trans-Hindon). ‚ÄúThey went instead to the puja room and locked it from inside.‚ÄùPolice say the girls used a plastic stool to climb up to the window. Their mother woke up and knocked on the door, asking them to open it, but received no response.Also read: ‚ÄòYou made Devu like Bollywood‚Äô: Did rift over youngest sibling push 3 Korea-obsessed Ghaziabad sisters to brink? Patil said that, according to the father‚Äôs statement, when he later woke up, he found the eldest daughter lying in the compound below. The two younger girls also jumped shortly after.A police field unit later broke open the puja room door. Inside, officers found childhood photographs of the three sisters scattered across the floor, along with a mobile phone and a pocket-sized diary.Police said the girls had taken their mother‚Äôs mobile phone before entering the puja room. The phone has been sent for forensic examination.A one-page handwritten note addressed to their father was also recovered. The note contained an apology ‚Äî ‚ÄúSorry Papa‚Äù ‚Äî and urged him to read their diary, with the words ‚ÄúREAD NOW‚Äù written in capital letters.Police and family members say the diary offers insight into the girls‚Äô state of mind.According to officers familiar with the investigation, the diary reveals a deep attachment to Korean popular culture, including K-pop music, television dramas and what is known as BL (boy love) content. The girls wrote that Korea had become central to their lives and expressed anger towards their father for opposing their interest.‚ÄúHow did you even dare to take this from us?‚Äù reads one line in the diary.Police sources say this may refer to an incident around 15 days earlier, when Kumar allegedly took away the elder daughter‚Äôs mobile phone and sold it.Police also said this could be a reference to their father Chetan Kumar, a stock trader allegedly deep in debt , taking away the elder daughter‚Äôs phone 15 days ago and selling it.He has not denied the girls‚Äô interest in Korean culture. ‚ÄúThey listened to Korean music, watched Korean films, dramas, web series and cartoons. They also wanted to go to Korea,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAll three wanted us to accept Korean culture, but when we refused, their behaviour changed. They went into a shell and lived in their own world.‚ÄùInvestigators say the girls had not attended school since the Covid-19 pandemic and were not being homeschooled. They also did not play with other children in the housing society.Writings found on the wall of their room point to a sense of isolation. Phrases such as ‚ÄúI am very, very alone‚Äù, ‚ÄúMy life is very very alone‚Äù and ‚ÄúMake me a heart of broken‚Äù were scribbled on the wall.According to police, the sisters spent nearly all their time together and appeared to have withdrawn from social life. In their diary, they referred to each other by names borrowed from television shows ‚Äî Maria , Aliza and Cindy ‚Äî and appeared to see themselves as living in a separate world.The diary lists 19 things the girls said their parents disapproved of, including Korean dramas and music, as well as Chinese, Japanese, Thai, American and British entertainment. They also mentioned cartoons such as Shin-chan and Doraemon, and several mobile games.‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt know how much we loved Korea,‚Äù the girls wrote. ‚ÄúThe way we loved Korean actors and K-pop groups, we didn‚Äôt even love family members that much.‚ÄùThe diary also refers to tensions within the family involving a younger sibling, a four-year-old girl referred to as ‚ÄúDevu‚Äù.The sisters wrote that they wanted to introduce Devu to their interests, but that their parents objected and instead encouraged her to watch Bollywood films. This, they wrote, caused further distress.‚ÄúYou made her Bollywood, which we hated more than life itself,‚Äù the diary reads.There are also references to physical punishment, although it is unclear who the girls were referring to. ‚ÄúDid we live in this world to get beaten by you?‚Äù one line reads. ‚ÄúDeath would be better for us than beatings.‚ÄùAnother passage mentions marriage, without detail. ‚ÄúThe mention of marriage caused tension in our hearts,‚Äù the diary says.Police believe the diary may have been written by the 14-year-old sister and estimate it was penned one or two days before the incident, possibly after an argument with their father. It has been sent for forensic analysis.Police say the family‚Äôs circumstances were complex. Kumar lives with three women who are sisters and claims to have married all of them. The eldest of the three girls who died and a younger boy are from his first wife. The two younger girls who died were born to her younger sister. The four-year-old girl mentioned in the diary is the child of the youngest sister.Officers say two of Kumar‚Äôs partners left the house in May 2025, prompting him to file missing persons reports. They returned a few days later.Investigators say Kumar suffered financial losses during the Covid-19 period and took loans thereafter, adding to stress within the household.Police say there were frequent arguments in the family over the girls‚Äô interests and lifestyle. No foul play has been suspected so far, but officers say the investigation is ongoing and forensic reports are awaited.‚ÄúThis is a tragic case involving children and a family under severe emotional and financial stress,‚Äù Patil said.
Article Summary: Three sisters, aged 16, 14 and 12, were found dead in the early hours of Wednesday after falling from the ninth floor of their apartment building in Ghaziabad, near Delhi. Police say the girls had not been going to school since Covid, nor were they homeschooled. ‚ÄòK-culture‚Äô seemed to have become their refuge; the sisters even called each other by names borrowed from TV shows and appeared to be living in a parallel world.

Article Title: No Chiefs, No Taylor Swift: Is Super Bowl LX About To Expose the NFL‚Äôs Ratings Myth?
Article Text:
NBC chases another Super Bowl ratings high without the Chiefs or Taylor Swift, leaning on Bad Bunny, Peacock, and record ad money. (Image via Getty)

Why Super Bowl LX May Fall Short of Another Ratings Record

NBC Is Chasing a Different Kind of Win With Ads, Streaming, and Bad Bunny

Super Bowl LX hits NBC on Feb. 8 with no Kansas City Chiefs and no Taylor Swift in sight. The NFL is chasing a fourth straight ratings record after last year‚Äôs Eagles-Chiefs matchup averaged 127.7 million viewers, fueled by Travis Kelce and Swift‚Äôs weekly storyline.This time the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks return to the big stage at Levi‚Äôs Stadium, with Bad Bunny at halftime and Peacock and Telemundo carrying the stream. It is still TV‚Äôs biggest night, but also a clean test of how much the league ever needed its most famous couple.Analysts cited by the Los Angeles Times say ‚Äúrecord-setting seems unlikely,‚Äù noting that the Chiefs and Swift brought in casual fans who may not rush back for Patriots-Seahawks, Part II. Nielsen now counts out-of-home viewing and millions of connected TVs, and the audience is younger and more female. The structural boost is real, even if the sugar rush has cooled.Without the Chiefs‚Äô built-in drama or Swift dropping viral moments from a suite, Sunday‚Äôs number will finally separate what came from new measurement and what came from celebrity.Even if the audience lands below 127.7 million, NBC is already winning where it matters.The network sold out Super Bowl LX ad inventory months ago at roughly $8 million per 30-second slot, with some hitting $10 million, plus separate Peacock-only buys bundled with this month‚Äôs Winter Olympics. If that package delivers record Super Bowl ad revenue while driving more people into Peacock and Telemundo, nobody will panic over a softer rating headline.The NFL has stood by Bad Bunny despite conservative backlash and a Turning Point USA ‚Äúcounter-show‚Äù with Kid Rock and country acts streaming elsewhere. Executives still remember the only counter-programming that really worked, Fox‚Äôs live ‚ÄúIn Living Color‚Äù episode in 1992 that pushed them toward booking global stars.If NBC comes anywhere near last year‚Äôs viewership while cashing a bigger ad check, the night will still feel like a win in the rooms that matter. Super Bowl LX may not break the record, but it will show whether the NFL‚Äôs ratings machine runs on one superstar couple or on something bigger.
Article Summary: Super Bowl LX hits NBC on Feb. 8 with no Kansas City Chiefs and no Taylor Swift in sight. The NFL is chasing a fourth straight ratings record after last year‚Äôs Eagles-Chiefs matchup averaged 127.7 million viewers. This time the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks return to the big stage.

Article Title: Chris Hemsworth‚Äôs Amazon Super Bowl stunt lands awkwardly, sparks employee backlash and controversy amid layoffs
Article Text:
A Super Bowl marketing moment that didn‚Äôt sit right internally.Image via: Getty

The moment a Super Bowl promotion struck the wrong nerve



Super Bowl week always brings strange side stories, but this one didn‚Äôt come from a commercial teaser or a celebrity tweet. It surfaced quietly inside a company system, where employees noticed something unusual just days before the championship game. Actor Chris Hemsworth had briefly appeared on an internal organizational chart of Amazon, complete with a flashy title and a company email address. With the Super Bowl approaching and ad campaigns rolling out at full speed, the appearance was clearly tied to one of the game‚Äôs high-profile commercials. But inside the company, the reaction wasn‚Äôt laughter or excitement. It was confusion, frustration, and, for some, anger.Chris Hemsworth was listed as ‚ÄúChief Heartthrob,‚Äù attached to a team connected to the technology featured in a Super Bowl ad. He was also labeled a bar raiser, a real internal designation usually reserved for employees involved in hiring decisions. The listing included a jokey quote attributed to him, as reported in Reuters. ‚ÄúWhen I‚Äôm not starring in movies, I enjoy spending time with my family, campaigning for Ad Meter votes, snake wrangling, bear wrestling, hammer throwing and a nice cinnamon scrub,‚Äù it read.The placement was part of a stunt tied to a Super Bowl commercial built around artificial intelligence. In the ad, Hemsworth imagines increasingly ridiculous scenarios involving an AI assistant, including being crushed by a garage door, drowning in his pool, and wrestling a bear sent after him. By the end, the assistant reassures him that it is ultimately a force for good. On television, it plays as dark humor. Inside the company, it landed differently.The moment came against a difficult backdrop. Recent layoffs at the company had affected thousands of corporate employees, including teams connected to the same technology being promoted in the ad. A disappointing earnings report had already shaken morale. For many employees, seeing a Hollywood star inserted into the org chart felt a bit out of touch.One employee wrote on an internal social platform, as per Reuters, ‚ÄúThis definitely makes up for the hollow feeling of cleaning out my peer‚Äôs desk and meeting him out front with his boxes given he was laid off last week.‚Äù Another added, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs less of a joke than it is an insult to the rest of us.‚ÄùBy late Thursday, the moment was over. Hemsworth‚Äôs mock role was removed, and his profile was updated to report under a standard department head.
Article Summary: Chris Hemsworth was listed as ‚ÄúChief Heartthrob,‚Äù attached to a team connected to the technology featured in a Super Bowl ad. He was also labeled a bar raiser, a real internal designation usually reserved for employees involved in hiring decisions. The listing included a jokey quote attributed to him.

Article Title: Patrick Mahomes and the Chiefs face more offseason change as the team may lose another trusted coach
Article Text:
Patrick Mahomes and Dan Williams (via Imagn Images and Getty Images)

Dan Williams could be the next departure as Arizona targets the Chiefs‚Äô quarterback staff

The Kansas City Chiefs are heading into a strange offseason, one that feels unfamiliar after years of stability. A 6-11 record and six straight losses to end the 2025 season knocked Kansas City out of the playoffs for the first time since 2014. Patrick Mahomes suffered a torn ACL midway through the month, ending his season early and putting his 2026 availability under real scrutiny.While some developments have happened, including the return of Eric Bieniemy as the OC, another vital member of the Chiefs may change outfits, as the Arizona Cardinals reportedly requested permission to interview Dan Williams for their open quarterbacks coach position. With Williams‚Äô rich history with the Chiefs and the vulnerable position that the team is in currently, it will be a great loss if Williams takes up the gig.Popular NFL reporter Cameron Wolfe wrote on X, "Arizona Cardinals have requested to interview Dan Williams for their QB coach position, per source. Williams is in Year 7 with Chiefs, the last 3 as assistant QB coach. A young rising coach and key figure for Patrick Mahomes with a chance for elevation."Several members of Andy Reid‚Äôs staff left for new opportunities, breaking up a group that had been together through multiple deep playoff runs.The biggest move was offensive coordinator Matt Nagy leaving to take a job with the New York Giants. Regarding the latest news about Williams, it gets quite complicated if he makes the move.Williams has been with the Chiefs since 2019, starting as a coaching intern before steadily earning more responsibility. He later served as an assistant to the head coach, a role that put him close to Reid and the team‚Äôs inner workings. In 2023, Williams was promoted to assistant quarterbacks coach under quarterbacks coach David Girardi.If Williams leaves, it would be another hit to a Chiefs team that is already trying to rebuild confidence and consistency. Kansas City finished 30th in points per game and struggled to maintain rhythm once injuries piled up and execution slipped. The Chiefs were 6-5 late in the season and still alive in the playoff race before everything fell apart.
Article Summary: Arizona Cardinals reportedly want to interview Kansas City Chiefs assistant Dan Williams. Chiefs finished 6-11 and missed the playoffs for the first time since 2014. Patrick Mahomes suffered a torn ACL midway through the month, ending his season early and putting his 2026 availability under real scrutiny.

Why the Super Bowl trophy still matters most

The Super Bowl does not really end when the clock hits zero. The night feels complete only when the winning team lifts the silver trophy in front of the world. His belief was simple: preparation decides everything. That idea still lives inside every Super Bowl locker room.The trophy is made completely of silver. It stands 22 inches tall and weighs about seven pounds. A football sits on top in kicking position, showing how every season begins.Each trophy costs around $50,000. According to the NFL, a brand-new trophy is created every year, and the winning team keeps it forever.For stars like Tom Brady, Patrick Mahomes, and Aaron Rodgers, lifting the trophy changed how their careers were remembered. One moment can turn a great player into a legend. That is the power of this trophy.In today‚Äôs NFL, money, fame, and records come quickly. But none of them replace the Super Bowl Trophy. It is the one thing every player wants, and most never touch. That reality keeps the trophy special every single year.

Why a Lewis Hamilton title push may have to wait until 2027

Remember that time when Lewis Hamilton shockingly switched to Ferrari? Fans say that it was one of the most dramatic moments in recent Formula 1 history. The seven-time World Champion stepped into the most dominant team in the sport with hopes of finally capturing an unprecedented eighth title. Immediately, fans across the globe imagined Hamilton leading the silence back to Maranello. But with this new partnership taking form, plenty of big-name observers have already been tempering expectations.One of those to issue a warning is sprinting legend Usain Bolt, no stranger to the Motormouth podcast himself, and a Hamilton fan for many years. The Jamaican, who is a seven-time world champion like Hamilton, believes the Briton will one day win at Ferrari, but he doubts that the journey back to the top will be quick or easy. Bolt believes the British driver may well have a sizeable transition period to endure before he can be seen as a genuine contender for a further title.As for Hamilton's move, Bolt stated matter-of-factly that he isn't bidding on a quick victory. Having dominated for years, he understands better than most how tough it can be for elite athletes to adapt to different circumstances.In an exclusive interview with RacingNews365, Bolt said,Bolt's comments indicate a growing view in motorsport that Hamilton's Ferrari project is more of a long-term play than a short-term solution. The team is still bridging the gap to its nearest competitors, and driving a different car in a new working environment takes time to adjust to, even for a driver of Hamilton's experience.Hamilton has already demonstrated with Ferrari in the early years of their rebuilding that a championship challenge does not come together overnight. While the car showed flashes of pace, making it consistent has proven more difficult. Ferrari is stuck in between a technical generation, while season after season, new regulation changes could shift the competitive order quicker than expected.The thinking among many analysts is that 2026 is the year that Hamilton's move to Ferrari becomes tangible, even if he and the Scuderia need that season to get to know each other perfectly. Only after laying that groundwork can a realistic title assault be attempted. Bolt therefore left the door open for the Briton needing another year or two, a line that suits that broader evaluation down to the ground.But while Hamilton is currently facing challenges, few would doubt his resolve or capability. He has shown he can restore a program to winning when he has the right pieces. However, for now, that message is just fine. Ferrari fans with fantasies of success taken from Hamilton on an ice tray are left dazed, while his victory may take too long to become new golden silverware, but Hamilton's next magnificent win with a trophy could be a little closer at hand.
Article Summary: Usain Bolt believes Lewis Hamilton faces a difficult transition at Ferrari. Bolt believes the British driver may well have a sizeable transition period to endure before he can be seen as a genuine contender for a further title. Bolt's comments indicate a growing view in motorsport that Hamilton's Ferrari project is more of a long-term play than a short-term solution.
